message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about cameras and their functions. Cameras are devices that capture and record images. Option (A) is correct because cameras can be used to take snapshots or photographs of friends wearing snapbacks. Option (B) is incorrect because cameras are not designed for microscopic properties, that would be a microscope. Option (C) is incorrect because while cameras can be used for surveillance or evidence gathering, they are not specifically designed for solving mysteries. Option (D) is incorrect because cameras capture images and do not physically take people on adventures.

This question requires knowledge about the purpose and capabilities of cameras. Cameras are devices that capture images and can be used to take snapshots of friends, including friends wearing snapbacks. Option (B) is incorrect because while some cameras may have microscopic capabilities, it is not a characteristic of all cameras. Option (C) is not necessarily true for all cameras as solving mysteries would require specific forensic or surveillance equipment. Option (D) is incorrect because cameras cannot physically take friends on an adventure, although they can capture memories of the adventure.
